project.name: Gentoo MIPS
project.description: The Gentoo/MIPS Project provides the Gentoo GNU/Linux operating system for mips-based platforms.
project.longdescription: Gentoo/MIPS is a port of the Gentoo GNU/Linux and the Gentoo Portage package management system to mips-based platforms. Primary focus is on the Silicon Graphics (SGI) line of mips-based workstations, specifically the Indy and Indigo2. Support is also available for the Cobalt Microserver Qube2/RaQ2 units and the SGI O2 R5000 units.

section.title: (29 Sep 2005): New Developer, Joel Martin (a.k.a kanaka)

body.p: We've grown again. Please make a warm welcome for Joel Martin, who has joined the MIPS team to assist with toolchain issues and clustering.
Another big gap in the site updates (over a year), and so there's lots to update people about.
3 new developers joined the MIPS team in this period.

ul.li: Aaron Walker (ka0ttic) is helping with the porting & arch testing efforts
Stephen Bennett (spb) is helping with porting SELinux to MIPS, and looking after security matters
Stuart Longland (redhatter) is helping with maintenance of the handbook, and the Cobalt port

body.p: The Gentoo/MIPS handbook has been completely rewritten from scratch, and now is available in its new home. In addition, we have a shiny new FAQ page to answer the most common questions.

Joshua Kinard has also been busy with the Gentoo/MIPS LiveCD. This is a boot CD for booting up Silicon Graphics Indy, Indigo2, Indigo2 Impact, O2, Origin 200/2000 and Octane systems. It's still very experimental, but has come a long way from the early attempts.

You can find the CD, as well as instructions on how to burn & use it on your local Gentoo mirror under gentoo/experimental/mips/livecd/. Please read the README file you find there -- these are not ISO images, and require special treatment regarding the burning process.

Gentoo 2005.0 has been released for some time now. 2005.1 is also available for SGI systems (the Cobalt 2005.1 images are in hiatus pending glibc issues). You'll now find stages on your local Gentoo mirror in the following locations:

Stuart Longland knocked up a very simple hardware support database, to assist users in finding kernel configuration settings for their hardware and known working combinations. The site allows users to post any kernel configs settings and success/failure stories.
You can find this database here. Contact Stuart Longland if you have any issues using this service. (and be patient when downloading from that site... it's hosted on a slow 512/128k ADSL link)

It's been awhile since the last update to the site, so people are likely wondering what all has been going on recently. For starters, we have a new developer to join the team, Hardave Riar. He joined a couple weeks ago to assist in various porting tasks, but will also assist in Octane work as Linux support for the system becomes better.

Newer stages for the 2004.2 release are available at the following locations:
SGI: http://dev.gentoo.org/~kumba/mips/releases/2004.2/
Cobalt: http://dev.gentoo.org/~kumba/mips/cobalt/releases/2004.2/
The official release date for 2004.2 was missed, so the stages are only on the above site for now. 2004.3 should be our next official release.
We have yet another new developer to join the MIPS ranks! Stephen Becker, a.k.a. geoman, will also work on Xfree86/Desktop related stuff, with Bret (psi29a).

We have a new developer to join the MIPS ranks. Please give a warm welcome to Bret Curtis, a.k.a., psi29a. Bret will be handling stuff in the Xfree86 and Desktop related sections, like KDE, Gaim, X-Chat and such. extraproject.name: Documentation
extraproject.p: Maintaining and updating documentation for Gentoo/MIPS.

extraproject.name: Stages/Netboot
extraproject.p: Creation of the Gentoo/MIPS stages for installation. A stage tarball is a UNIX compressed tar archive of a chrootable environment for installing Gentoo.
Netboot images are for the initial booting of an environment to unpack the stages and install Gentoo.

extraproject.name: SGI O2 Porting
extraproject.p: The stabilization of the linux kernel on SGI O2 systems and sucessful installation and running of Gentoo/MIPS in a multi-user environment. If you have an SGI O2 with an R5000 or R12000 CPU and wish to help with this subproject, then this is the team you will want to contact.

extraproject.name: Cobalt MIPS
extraproject.p: Creation of installation stages and documentation for installing Gentoo/MIPS on the Cobalt Microserver RaQ[2]/Qube[2] machines.

extraproject.name: LiveCD
extraproject.p: The creation and maintainence of a LiveCD for installing Gentoo/MIPS.

extrachapter.title: Installation Guide, Mailing Lists, and IRC Channel

body.p: Those interested in running Gentoo/MIPS on an SGI or Cobalt MIPS-based system can get started by reading the Handbook. You may also find the FAQ page a useful read. Help can be obtained by subscribing to the gentoo-mips mailing list. More information about subscribing to a Gentoo mailing list can be found on the Mailing Lists page.
Those with access to an IRC Client can join #gentoo-mips on irc.freenode.net for general questions, help, or just to talk with others using Gentoo/MIPS.
